Property: Ieudun Tomb 伊江御殿 墓 Ieudun baka
Comments: turtle-back tomb of the Ie line , descendants of the seventh son of Shō Sei , fourth king of the Second Shō Dynasty

Property: Sonohyan-utaki Stone Gate 園比屋武御嶽石門 Sonohyan-utaki sekimon
Comments: heavily damaged during the war and restored to its previous form in 1957 ; part of the Prefectural Historic Site and of the UNESCO World Heritage Site Gusuku Sites and Related Properties of the Kingdom of Ryukyu

Property: Chunnaagaa 喜友名泉 Chunnaagaa
Former Enkaku-ji Hōjō Bridge 旧 円覚寺 放生橋 kyū-Engakuji Hōjō-bashi
Comments: Enkaku-ji was founded by Shō Shin in 1492 ; all its wooden buildings were destroyed during the war ; the ornately carved bridge suffered minor damage and has since been restored ; its carvings are a Prefectural Cultural Property

Property: Miyaradunchi 旧宮良殿内 kyū-Miyaradunchi
Comments: residence of a senior Pechin ; the gardens are a Place of Scenic Beauty

Property: Former Sōgen-ji First Gate and Stone Wall 旧崇元寺第一門及び石牆 kyū-Sōgenji daiichimon oyobi sekishō
Comments: Sōgenji , said to have been founded in 1470 , was destroyed during the war ; the gate was restored in 1952

Property: Former Nakazato Magiri Warehouse Overseer 's Stone Walls 旧仲里間切蔵元石牆 kyū-Nakazato magiri kuramoto sekishō
Former Yonaguni Family Residence 旧与那国家住宅 kyū-Yonaguni-ke jūtaku
Comments: part of the Taketomi Preservation District for Groups of Traditional Buildings

Property: Former Waukei Family Tomb 旧和宇慶家墓 kyū-Waukei-ke haka
Comments: combines a roofed cave burial chamber with a walled courtyard

Property: Tamaudun 玉御殿 Tamaudun
Comments: designation comprises two components : the burial chamber and stone wall

Property: Tamaudun 玉陵 Tamaudun
Comments: designation comprises five components : the central chamber for temporary burial prior to washing the bones and final entombment , east chamber for the entombment of kings and queens , west chamber for the entombment of other members of the royal family , and inner and outer stone walls ; also an Historic Site and part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site Gusuku Sites and Related Properties of the Kingdom of Ryukyu

Property: Gongen-dō 権現堂 Gongendō
Comments: designation comprises two components : the shinden and haiden ; first constructed in 1614 , destroyed by the 1771 Great Yaeyama Tsunami , and rebuilt the following decade

Property: Takara Family Residence 高良家住宅 Takara-ke jūtaku
Uezu Family Residence 上江洲家住宅 Uezu-ke jūtaku
Comments: designation comprises two components : the main building and anteroom

Property: Aragaki Family Residence 新垣家住宅 Aragaki-ke jūtaku
Comments: designation comprises four components : the nineteenth-century main building and workshop , and the 1911 annex and climbing kiln ; a potter 's house ( tsuboya-yaki ( 壺屋焼 ) )

Property: Sesoko Toteikun 瀬底土帝君 Sesoko tōteīkun
Comments: on Sesokojima ( 瀬底島 ) ; complex includes honden , haiden , garden , stone walls , hearth

Property: Former Ōgimi Village Office Building 大宜味村役場旧庁舎 Ōgimi-son yakuba kyū-chōsha
Nakamura Family Residence 中村家住宅 Nakamura-ke jūtaku
Comments: designation comprises five components : the main building ( late Edo to Meiji period ) , anteroom , annexe , storehouse , and pigpen or fuuru ( all Meiji period )

Property: Nakandakari Riverside Facilities 仲村渠樋川 Nakandakari hiijaa
Comments: amenities include a fountain , retaining walls , pavements etc

Property: Tsukayama Distillery 津嘉山酒造所施設 Tsukayama shuzōsho shisetsu
Comments: awamori distillery ; designation comprises two components : the main building and distillery
